intro: Codonopsis convolvulacea var. heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves. The plant produces bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique leaf morphology and ornamental flowers make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
